definition: face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: He has a competive quarrel with his boss.
sentences.chinese: 他和老闆爭得面紅耳赤。

sentences.english: Mr. holohan became very red and excited .
sentences.chinese: 霍羅漢變得面紅耳赤，激動極了。

sentences.english: Nikki began to feel abashed by his praise of her beauty.
sentences.chinese: 他讚美着尼基的美貌，使她羞得面紅耳赤。

sentences.english: You can talk things over, or even argue, with your boss.
sentences.chinese: 你可以和老闆討論事情，甚至可以爭得面紅耳赤。

sentences.english: Red in the face, Klaette no longer has prevaricated anything.
sentences.chinese: 面紅耳赤的科萊特再也支吾不出什麼了。

sentences.english: Rostov flushing hotly drew Dolohov away into the other room.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯托夫面紅耳赤，把多洛霍夫喊到另一間房裏。

sentences.english: The fire was finally extinguished, but she was still a blushing beauty in tears.
sentences.chinese: 火終於撲滅，但妻子卻成了面紅耳赤的淚美人。

sentences.english: He argued with the boss until he was blue in the face.
sentences.chinese: 他和老闆爭得面紅耳赤。

sentences.english: This wedding shines on to paint really make me redden up to the ears.
sentences.chinese: 這個結婚照畫得真是讓我面紅耳赤。

sentences.english: Kit shared his views and we had a lot of good arguments.
sentences.chinese: 基特和傑克遜的觀點一樣，我們常常爭得面紅耳赤。

definition: lit. hair stands up in anger and tips off one's hat (idiom)/fig. seething in anger/raise one's hackles
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
hard to distinguish real from imitation
